title: Devices are in sync
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device
AND user is logged in the device
AND the user is logged in to web as well with the same credentails

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user plays the game on mobile device
AND the user opens the HRD on web while logged in
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees their previous submissions

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user played the game on web
AND the opens the HRD on mobile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees their previous submissions

title: MLB Play and mlb.com integration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB Play app installed on device
AND user is logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits their pick
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user can successfully submit their picks without asking to log in

title: XP
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views the HRD game card
custom_expected: THEN user is displayed with 250 XP on the bottom left corner of the card

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user played the HRD
AND HRD is final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user gets 250 XP

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the result feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user DOES NOT see HRD result card

title: Token
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the HRD game card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with 5 tokens on the bottom left corner of the card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made correct picks in Round 1
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives 5 tokens for each correct pick

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made correct picks in Round 2
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives 10 tokens for each correct pick

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made correct picks in Final rouns
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives 15 tokens for each correct pick

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicts all bracket
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user received 55 tokens

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicts longest home run hitter + the distance
custom_steps_separated.expected: THE user receives 45 tokens
The max tokens user can receive is 100

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the result feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user DO NOT see HRD result card

title: Reward Pack
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user plays the HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits their HRD picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user received the rare Reward Pack after submission (1Rare, 2 Common)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the reward Pack (in the feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the copy for the Feed event should read: “You unlocked a Rewards Pack for your Home Run Derby submission!”

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user updates their picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user does NOT receive another Reward Pack

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user's region is set to US or Canada
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees the HRD game card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user's region is set to any other country
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user does not see the HRD game card

title: HRD Game Card position
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Games tab on the HRD launch date
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Home Run Derby’s game card has the topmost position

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Games tab after the HRD is final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Home Run Derby’s game card has the bottom most position

title: Game Card - unlocked state
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in 
AND user is on the Game tab
AND HRD has unlocked state (scheduled)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the HRD card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with

* Home Run Derby logo in the center
* 250 XP on the bottom left corner
* 5 token on the bottom left corner next to XP
* background image

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the game card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the Home Run Derby tutorial page or bracket (if played already)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits their picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the HRD game card has a check mark

title: Game Card - locked state
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is on the Game tab
AND HRD has a locked state (live or final)
custom_expected: THEN user should display with Diamond Derby game card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the HRD card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be displayed with

* Home Run Derby logo in the center
* 250 XP on the bottom left corner
* 5 token on the bottom left corner next to XP
* background image
* lock icon is displayed in the top right corner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the game card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the tutorial page (double check - could be bracket)

title: Dinger Winner
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD
AND HRD is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicted the HRD winner
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives the Dinger Winner badge

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the badge in the feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the copy should say  'Correctly predict the Home Run Derby winner'

title: Moon Shot
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD
AND HRD is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicted the longest home (tiebreaker question)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives the Moon Shot badge

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicted the HRD longest homer distance flag (tiebreaker question)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives the Moon Shot badge

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicts the longest home and HRD longest homer distance flag
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives one badge (double check)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the badge in the feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the copy should say  ' Correctly predict the longest homer in the Home Run Derby'

title: Perfect Game: Home Run Derby
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD
AND HRD is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicted the entire Home Run Derby bracket (HRD Round 1 flag AND HRD Round 2 flag AND HRD Winner prediction flag )
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives the Perfect Game badge AND Dinger Winner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Perfect Game badge in the feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the copy should say  'Correctly predict the entire Home Run Derby bracket'

title: Season Champion: Home Run Derby
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD
AND HRD is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user correctly predicted the entire Home Run Derby bracket AND longest homer batter flag OR HRD longest homer distance flag
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives the Season Champion badge

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the badge in the feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the copy should say  'Correctly predict the entire Home Run Derby bracket'
AND user receives 100 points

title: Brackets UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is viewing brackets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with: 

* batter's name (first name is truncated if long)
* correct number
* headshot
* correct batter's position
* correct seeding
* correct team logo on the right side of the batter

title: Making a pick flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is playing HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the HRD card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is brought to the bracket tutorial page (webview) - separate tc

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks 'Enter Bracket'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with a bracket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the batter from the first matchup
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN selected batter changes the accent color to bright pink
AND selected batter moves to next round

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selected batter in the final matchup
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the batters name, headshot and team name appears on the right side
AND 'Submit My Picks' button gets enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Submit My Picks' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the tiebreaker page is displayed (separate TC)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user answers the tiebreaker questions
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN 'Submit My Picks' button gets enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Submit My Picks' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's picks are submitted 
AND user receives a submission email (separate tc)
AND user is awarded with rare Reward Pack

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user reopens the HRD card after submitting picks
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the tutorial page is not displayed 
AND user can see their picks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits their pick
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the HRD game card has a check mark

title: Tiebreaker page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is playing HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made picks and clicked on 'Submit My Picks' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with Tiebreaker page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Tiebreaker page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* 'Required Questions' section - required
* 'Tiebreaker Questions' section - non required
* DOB field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters input in the fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN fields only accept numeric and no letters and special characters

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters valid input
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is able to submit picks 
AND 'Submit My Picks' button is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN required fields have no input
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is not able to proceed and 'Submit My Picks' button is disabled
AND 'Please answer all required questions*' pop up is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the first question
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN it should only accepts values 1-8

title: Tutorial page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is playing HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the HRD bracket before submitting any picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the tutorial page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the tutorial page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with
* Home Run Derby image
* title: Pick the perfect T-Mobile Home Run Derby® bracket and compete to win $100,000!
* copy: 
You can edit your selections until 5 minutes before the Home Run Derby begins on July 18. (with correct date!)
* legal copy
* 'Enter Bracket' button

Note: no mlb.com link should be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on Official Rules
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 2022 T-Mobile Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge webpage is open
https://www.mlb.com/brackets/home-run-derby/rules

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on 'Enter Bracket' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is displayed with bracket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks outside the 'Enter Bracket' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user stays on tutorial page (currently a bug)

title: Submission email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is playing HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits the picks
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user receives an email

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Q-Unqj0V35unzzXOLB_fI0hWVnOLqmTTx0gqJNEsmUw/edit#

title: Changing picks flow
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD
AND all games are live (not locked)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the HRD bracket
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees the their picks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user updated the pick
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the selected batter changes the accent color to bright pink
AND selected batter is updated in the next round
AND the next round selection is removed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made new picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN 'Submit My Picks' button is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user submits the picks
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user receives another submission email

title: DOB field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user is playing HRD
AND user is on Tiebreaker page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters the  DOB which is >18
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to submit their picks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user enters DOB which is under 18
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is not able to submit their picks and 'Sorry! You are not eligible to play the brackets' pop up is displayed.
Future update - the DOB should be pulling from user's account

title: Each player will have their name, jersey number and playing position displayed in player card
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have Pete Alonso configured for  "brackets/te-home-run-derby-bracket" bracket
custom_steps:
WHEN I view the bracket in a web URL
AND I look into Pete Alonso's player card in the bracket matchup
custom_expected:
THEN I should see Pete Alonso displayed on his card
AND I should see his jersey number to be #20
AND I should see his playing position as 1B
AND I should see his player headshot in the player card

title: Bracket is locked - user played
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user made HRD picks

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the HRD game card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the HRD card has a lock icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on HRD game card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with the bracket
AND user can see their picks
AND user is not able to update the picks
AND 'Submit Picks' button is not there
AND user is displayed with the modal 'The bracket contest is now locked. You can no longer edit your picks. Check back soon to see the results!'

title: Bracket is locked - user didn't play
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user didn't play

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the HRD game card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the HRD game card has a lock icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on HRD game card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with the bracket
AND bracket has no picks
AND user is not able to make picks
AND 'Submit Picks' button is not there
AND user is displayed with the modal 'The bracket contest is now locked. You can no longer edit your picks. Check back soon to see the results!'

title: Matchup is final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the matchup is final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the scores are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made correct pick
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the matchup card has a checkmark with green background (on the left)
AND selected batters name is displayed in the the next matchup above position 1 or below position 2 and is not crossed (in green)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user made incorrect pick
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the matchup card has a 'X' with red background (on the left)
AND selected batters name is displayed in the the next matchup above position 1 or below position 2 and is crossed (in red)
AND batters name who won the matchup is displayed in the next round

title: Round is final
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the whole round is final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN all matchups have the final score
AND the 'final' tag is displayed under the Round header

title: All rounds are final - user played
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user played HRD 
AND the game is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the bracket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees

* all matchups have scores
* all rounds have 'final' title
* the winner section displays the winner with the headshot, name and team name
* no CTA button is displayed

AND user is able to see their picks results (Matchup is final tc)

title: All rounds are final - user didn't play
custom_preconds:
GIVEN web app is opened on browser
AND user is logged in
AND user play didn't play HRD
AND the game is final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the b bracket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user sees

* all matchups have scores
* all rounds have 'final' title
* the winner section displays the winner with the headshot, name and team name
* no CTA button is displayed

title: Round 1 picks verification
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am using "brackets/te-home-run-derby-bracket" bracket
AND I have the following picks for Round1:
1 vs 8: topSeed
4 vs 5: topSeed
3 vs 6: bottomSeed
2 vs 7: topSeed

AND the following is the entry in [Contentful](https://app.contentful.com/spaces/iiozhi00a8lc/entries/5Ik7aHVCmHS0Z8V1Kkobaw):
               |ToSeed|BottomSeed|
matchup 1 vs 8 |21    |20        |  
matchup 4 vs 5 |18    |17        |  
matchup 3 vs 6 |24    |32        |  
matchup 2 vs 7 |20    |19        |
custom_steps: WHEN the bracket is in scoring phase
custom_expected: THEN I should see all my picks to be correct for Round 1

GIVEN I am using "brackets/te-home-run-derby-bracket" bracket
AND I have the following picks for Round1:

|ToSeed|BottomSeed|

matchup 4 vs 5 |18 |17 |
matchup 3 vs 6 |24 |32 |

AND I have the following for Round 2 picks:

title: Page name should reflect the current year in the tracking call
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the HRD page
AND I have [Adobe Analytics Debugger](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/debugger-for-adobe-analyt/bdingoflfadhnjohjaplginnpjeclmof) extension enable
AND I am watching the browser console
AND Pete Alonso is participating in the bracket challenge
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on the Pete Alonso for Round 1
AND I observer the tracking events in the console
custom_expected:
THEN I should see "Major League Baseball: Brackets" for prop12
AND I should see "Major League Baseball: Brackets: <current_year> T-Mobile Home Run Derby Bracket Challenge " for prop13 # the year value will vary every year

title: Player id and other relevant information will be shared via tracking events
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the HRD page
AND I have [Adobe Analytics Debugger](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/debugger-for-adobe-analyt/bdingoflfadhnjohjaplginnpjeclmof) extension enable
AND I am watching the browser console
AND Pete Alonso is participating in the bracket challenge
custom_steps:
WHEN I click on the Pete Alonso for Round 1
AND I observer the tracking events in the console
custom_expected:
THEN I should see "624413" for prop3
AND I should see "Pete Alonso" for evar140
AND I should see "Bracket: Seed Selection: Round 1" for prop14

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I click on the Pete Alonso for Round 2
AND I observer the tracking events in the console
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I should see "624413" for prop3
AND I should see "Pete Alonso" for evar140
AND I should see "Bracket: Seed Selection: Round 2" for prop14

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I click on the Pete Alonso for the final Round
AND I observer the tracking events in the console
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I should see "624413" for prop3
AND I should see "Pete Alonso" for evar140
AND I should see "Bracket: Seed Selection: Final" for prop14

title: [POSTSEASON BRACKET] Club abbreviation will be shared via evar140
Non logged in user submissions will result in firing an event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the HRD page
AND I am not logged into the app
AND I have Adobe Analytics Debugger extension enable
AND I am watching the browser console
custom_steps:
WHEN I make my selections for HRD
AND I submit my tie breaker answers
AND I observer the tracking events in the console
custom_expected:
THEN I should see an analytics call being made
AND I should see "Bracket: Tiebreaker Submit Success" for prop14

title: Tiebreaker submission will fire a tracking event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on the HRD page
AND I am logged into the app [mlb app or site]
AND I have Adobe Analytics Debugger extension enable
AND I am watching the browser console
custom_steps:
WHEN I make my selections for HRD
AND I submit my tie breaker answers
AND I hit ok in the pop up confirmation box
custom_expected:
THEN I should see an analytics call being made
AND I should see "Bracket: Success: Ok " for prop14

title: Enter the bracket by clicking on "Enter Bracket" button will trigger a call
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am on the HRD page
custom_steps:
WHEN I am present with the welcome screen of the bracket
AND I press on "Enter Bracket" button
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking even firing 
AND I should see "Bracket: Modal: Play Game" for prop14

title: Tracking events for app/atbat app
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am loading HRD bracket with app/atbat url
custom_steps: WHEN I first visit the page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking event
AND I should see "app/atbat" for eVar63
AND I should see "ATBAT" for prop8

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I select a player
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I should see the player id for prop3
AND I should see name for eVar140
AND I should see ATBAT for prop8
AND I should see at/bat for eVar63
AND I should see the picked round for prop14

title: Tracking events for app/ballpark app
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am visiting HRD page
custom_steps: WHEN I perform an action within the bracket page
custom_expected:
THEN I should see a tracking event for the action 
AND I should see "ATTHEBALLPARK" for prop8
AND I should see "app/ballpark" for eVar63
